intro: Haemadictyon refulgens, commonly known as the rainbow plant, is a striking member of the Araliaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America and is characterized by its vibrant, colorful foliage. The plant features compound leaves with a unique, almost iridescent sheen, which gives it its common name. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically white or greenish-white, and it produces berries that range in color from yellow to red. Haemadictyon refulgens is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its eye-catching appearance and ease of care.
